<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
RETAIL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/03/01/buynowpaylater-giant-klarna-worth-31-billion-latest-round-funding?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Big Swedish Fish Gets Bigger
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Klarna credit card machine " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80MjIyL2tsYXJuYS5KUEciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Klarna, the Swedish fintech giant that offers consumers buy-now-pay-later (BNPL) shopping options, announced yesterday it had <a href="https://techcrunch.com/2021/03/01/invest-now-sell-later/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">raised another $1 billion</a> at a $31 billion valuation. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">One of the earliest companies to the BNPL game, Klarna offers consumers the option to pay for an item online in installments rather than all at once. Klarna's closest American equivalent is Affirm, which went public in January and is currently worth ~$24 billion.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Why the BNPL hype? </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Klarna's style of financing is especially popular with younger consumers who don't have a credit card and appreciate the opportunity to spread out their spending. Roughly 20% of millennials used a BNPL service in 2020, nearly double the rate of Gen X, <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/macys-gap-neiman-marcus-will-let-you-buy-now-pay-later-11614520800?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">according to the WSJ</a>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Department stores are taking notice.</strong> Last October, Macy's agreed to take a stake in Klarna in exchange for offering its BNPL service as an option at checkout. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>But BNPL has put retail giants in a pickle. Companies like Macy's and Neiman Marcus still rely heavily on store- and co-branded credit card fees to pad their bottom lines, offerings that compete with BNPL options.</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The Macy's deal shows that old-school retailers are willing to sacrifice some of those dollars if BNPL gets more young people through the door.</span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">To regulators, BNPL is kinda like tequila</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It's fine in moderation. In Britain, where BNPL usage almost quadrupled last year, <a href="https://www.ft.com/content/2c9bd737-80a6-45d7-a7f3-bf672850b3bd?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">regulators are scrambling</a> to draft rules to cover this unique form of credit lending. The target of their angst? Late fees. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>If someone misses two payments, Klarna charges a penalty fee of up to $7, capped at 25% of the total purchase price. </span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>That concerns regulators, since more than than 10% of customers at one bank that had used BNPL were already behind on their payments, according to the UK's Financial Conduct Authority.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Klarna's BNPL business is already active in 17 countries and has over 250,000 retail partners, but the company is looking to evolve into an all-in-one banking app. The startup offers <a href="https://www.pymnts.com/news/banking/2021/klarna-offers-german-bank-account-in-move-toward-all-in-one-app/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">a range of licensed banking services</a> and recently rolled out consumer bank accounts in Germany.</p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GOVERNMENT
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/03/01/senate-prepares-stimulus-vote?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
This Time, the Bill Is Doing the Splitting
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/03/01/senate-prepares-stimulus-vote" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Biden stimulus plan" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zOTc0L2JpZGVuX3N0aW11bHVzX3BsYW4uanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">A $15 federal minimum wage <a href="https://www.npr.org/2021/03/01/971824282/covid-19-relief-package-heads-to-senate-as-debate-over-minimum-wage-continues?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">continues to divide</a> lawmakers like mayo on fries. This past weekend, the House passed President Biden's $1.9 trillion stimulus package, which included a minimum wage hike. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">As soon as Wednesday, the Senate will vote on its version. It also <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/senate-moves-ahead-with-covid-19-aid-package-without-minimum-wage-boost-11614615765?mod=hp_lead_pos4&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">includes</a> $1,400 direct payments, $400/week in unemployment benefits, $350 billion for state and local governments, and funding for vaccine distribution and schools...but the $15/hour will be missing. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">It's a win for centrists</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Like their House colleagues, Senate Republicans will likely unanimously oppose the bill. With the chamber split 50–50, Democrats can't lose a single vote.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Now that the wage increase is out, a handful of moderate Democrats who were skeptical of it are more likely to support the bill. If it passes, the House will need to vote again on a matching version.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>Pandemic containment and relief are Biden's top priority. This bill is a "test of his ability to unite Democrats in the Senate...and risks lasting damage to his influence should he fail," the AP <a href="https://apnews.com/article/senate-dems-changes-to-virus-bill-e2e975f9c62ea596bc1738df64af35e1?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">writes</a>.  </p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
DEALS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/03/01/spacs-start-2021-torrid-pace?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Newsletter Writers Seeing Another SPAC Announcement
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Gif of Jim from the Office" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=375 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/2Wim5ftHoDdJ1RNpuS/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Gif of Jim from the Office" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/2Wim5ftHoDdJ1RNpuS/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">SPACs, or special purpose acquisition companies, did a record $109 billion in transactions globally in February, <a href="https://www.ft.com/content/abcf1dad-833d-4620-ab57-96ea01d918ed?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">according to the FT</a>. And through two months this year, SPAC activity (in terms of count) is already at 75% of last year's total, says Capital Markets Gateway. <strong style="color:#000"></strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Quick refresher: </strong></span><span>A SPAC is a shell company that goes public, raises money, then uses those funds to acquire a private company and, in doing so, take </span><span><em>them</em></span><span> public.</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Everyone from Paul Ryan to Shaquille O'Neal to Serena Williams is involved in one. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The latest SPAC deal is <a href="https://techcrunch.com/2021/03/01/rocket-lab-ceo-peter-beck-explains-why-the-company-needs-a-bigger-rocket-and-why-its-going-public-to-build-it/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Rocket Lab</a>, a leader in launching small satellites into space. Tired of only being known for small rockets, the company said yesterday it's merging with a SPAC to raise funds and develop a rocket for heavier payloads, called Neutron. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>SPACs have been around for decades, but only in the last few months have they exploded in popularity as an alternative means to go public.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">+ Further reading: </strong>Anyone who's anyone has a SPAC right now. (<a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/02/27/style/SPACS-celebrity-craze.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">NYT</a>)</p>

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">

</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">

</font></a>

</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">As proprietors of a daily e-newsletter, we’ve become masters at meeting deadlines. But if you aren’t (no judgment), we think it’s semi-urgent to remind you that tax season is well underway. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Luckily, <a href="https://ad.doubleclick.net/ddm/clk/484440674;291136607;l" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">H&R Block’s team of seasoned tax pros</a> are here to help—so allow us to drop their immense wealth of knowledge on you guys. (Seriously, <strong style="color:#000">Block guarantees your max refund—or your money back</strong>.)</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">With Block, you can <strong style="color:#000">do your taxes on your own terms</strong>. <strong style="color:#000"></strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Visit an office: </strong></span><span>Walk in, make an appointment, or just drop off your docs and go.</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Keep it remote: </strong></span><span>Send ’em a pic of your docs, and they’ll do the work. Just sign and approve online.</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Do it yourself: </strong></span><span>Block has tax pros ready to help, if you need it.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">So if you’ve been really, really putting off your taxes, rest assured Block has some really, really good resources for you.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="https://ad.doubleclick.net/ddm/clk/484440674;291136607;l" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Learn how Block has your back this tax season</a>.</p>

<img alt="Sen. Elizabeth Warren (D-MA) speaks during a news conference concerning the extension of eviction protections in the next coronavirus bill, at the U.S. Capitol on July 22, 2020 in Washington, DC. " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80MjIxL2VsaXphYmV0aF93YXJyZW4uanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Drew Angerer/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">One penny more and you would be facing an extra 2% tax under a <a href="https://www.axios.com/warren-tax-bill-wealth-finance-millionaires-d966c220-31ff-4980-bc45-8e4531771ad8.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">new proposal</a> from Dems including Sen. Elizabeth Warren. Billionaires would be hit with 3%.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Warren's wealth tax proposal, a carryover from her run for president, would affect ~100,000 households and raise an estimated $2.8 trillion over 10 years, money its sponsors say <a href="https://thehill.com/policy/finance/540968-warren-offers-bill-to-create-wealth-tax-on-net-worth-above-50-million?rl=1&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">could support</a> child care, early education, and infrastructure. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Wealth taxes are distinct from the income taxes you're probably filing right now. They apply to net worth, i.e., your <strong style="color:#000">physical assets</strong> (houses, cars, grandma's sapphire collection) plus <strong style="color:#000">intangible assets</strong> (stocks, grandma's new SPAC collection) minus<strong style="color:#000"> debts</strong> (loans, mortgages, etc.). </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">While many politicians agree the ultra-wealthy should pay more, some disagree about whether wealth taxes are the way to go. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Last week, Treasury Sec. Janet Yellen </span><span><a href="https://www.businessinsider.com/janet-yellen-taxes-treasury-secretary-wealth-tax-implementation-capital-gains-2021-2?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said</a></span><span> a wealth tax has been discussed, but given "very difficult implementation problems," the Biden administration would rather look into increased corporate or capital gains taxes. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>The bill isn't expected to pass, even with Democratic control of Congress and the White House. But don't expect the party's progressive wing to stop trying. </p>

style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nRETAIL\n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/03/01/buynowpaylater-giant-klarna-worth-31-billion-latest-round-funding?email={{profile.email}}\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nBig Swedish Fish Gets Bigger\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Klarna credit card machine \" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80MjIyL2tsYXJuYS5KUEciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eKlarna, the Swedish fintech giant that offers consumers buy-now-pay-later (BNPL) shopping options, announced yesterday it had \u003ca href=\"https://techcrunch.com/2021/03/01/invest-now-sell-later/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eraised another $1 billion\u003c/a\u003e at a $31 billion valuation. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOne of the earliest companies to the BNPL game, Klarna offers consumers the option to pay for an item online in installments rather than all at once. Klarna's closest American equivalent is Affirm, which went public in January and is currently worth ~$24 billion.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhy the BNPL hype? \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eKlarna's style of financing is especially popular with younger consumers who don't have a credit card and appreciate the opportunity to spread out their spending. Roughly 20% of millennials used a BNPL service in 2020, nearly double the rate of Gen X, \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/macys-gap-neiman-marcus-will-let-you-buy-now-pay-later-11614520800?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eaccording to the WSJ\u003c/a\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eDepartment stores are taking notice.\u003c/strong\u003e Last October, Macy's agreed to take a stake in Klarna in exchange for offering its BNPL service as an option at checkout. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBut BNPL has put retail giants in a pickle. Companies like Macy's and Neiman Marcus still rely heavily on store- and co-branded credit card fees to pad their bottom lines, offerings that compete with BNPL options.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe Macy's deal shows that old-school retailers are willing to sacrifice some of those dollars if BNPL gets more young people through the door.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eTo regulators, BNPL is kinda like tequila\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIt's fine in moderation. In Britain, where BNPL usage almost quadrupled last year, \u003ca href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/2c9bd737-80a6-45d7-a7f3-bf672850b3bd?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eregulators are scrambling\u003c/a\u003e to draft rules to cover this unique form of credit lending. The target of their angst? Late fees. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIf someone misses two payments, Klarna charges a penalty fee of up to $7, capped at 25% of the total purchase price. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThat concerns regulators, since more than than 10% of customers at one bank that had used BNPL were already behind on their payments, according to the UK's Financial Conduct Authority.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eKlarna's BNPL business is already active in 17 countries and has over 250,000 retail partners, but the company is looking to evolve into an all-in-one banking app. The startup offers \u003ca href=\"https://www.pymnts.com/news/banking/2021/klarna-offers-german-bank-account-in-move-toward-all-in-one-app/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ea range of licensed banking services\u003c/a\u003e and recently rolled out consumer bank accounts in Germany.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eA $15 federal minimum wage \u003ca href=\"https://www.npr.org/2021/03/01/971824282/covid-19-relief-package-heads-to-senate-as-debate-over-minimum-wage-continues?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003econtinues to divide\u003c/a\u003e lawmakers like mayo on fries. This past weekend, the House passed President Biden's $1.9 trillion stimulus package, which included a minimum wage hike. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAs soon as Wednesday, the Senate will vote on its version. It also \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/senate-moves-ahead-with-covid-19-aid-package-without-minimum-wage-boost-11614615765?mod=hp_lead_pos4\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eincludes\u003c/a\u003e $1,400 direct payments, $400/week in unemployment benefits, $350 billion for state and local governments, and funding for vaccine distribution and schools...but the $15/hour will be missing. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eIt's a win for centrists\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLike their House colleagues, Senate Republicans will likely unanimously oppose the bill. With the chamber split 50–50, Democrats can't lose a single vote.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eNow that the wage increase is out, a handful of moderate Democrats who were skeptical of it are more likely to support the bill. If it passes, the House will need to vote again on a matching version.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003ePandemic containment and relief are Biden's top priority. This bill is a \"test of his ability to unite Democrats in the Senate...and risks lasting damage to his influence should he fail,\" the AP \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/senate-dems-changes-to-virus-bill-e2e975f9c62ea596bc1738df64af35e1?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSPACs, or special purpose acquisition companies, did a record $109 billion in transactions globally in February, \u003ca href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/abcf1dad-833d-4620-ab57-96ea01d918ed?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eaccording to the FT\u003c/a\u003e. And through two months this year, SPAC activity (in terms of count) is already at 75% of last year's total, says Capital Markets Gateway. \u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eQuick refresher: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eA SPAC is a shell company that goes public, raises money, then uses those funds to acquire a private company and, in doing so, take \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003ethem\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e public.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eEveryone from Paul Ryan to Shaquille O'Neal to Serena Williams is involved in one. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe latest SPAC deal is \u003ca href=\"https://techcrunch.com/2021/03/01/rocket-lab-ceo-peter-beck-explains-why-the-company-needs-a-bigger-rocket-and-why-its-going-public-to-build-it/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eRocket Lab\u003c/a\u003e, a leader in launching small satellites into space. Tired of only being known for small rockets, the company said yesterday it's merging with a SPAC to raise funds and develop a rocket for heavier payloads, called Neutron. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eSPACs have been around for decades, but only in the last few months have they exploded in popularity as an alternative means to go public.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e+ Further reading: \u003c/strong\u003eAnyone who's anyone has a SPAC right now. (\u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/02/27/style/SPACS-celebrity-craze.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid (Seriously, \u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBlock guarantees your max refund—or your money back\u003c/strong\u003e.)\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWith Block, you can \u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003edo your taxes on your own terms\u003c/strong\u003e. \u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eVisit an office: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eWalk in, make an appointment, or just drop off your docs and go.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eKeep it remote: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eSend ’em a pic of your docs, and they’ll do the work. Just sign and approve online.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eDo it yourself: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBlock has tax pros ready to help, if you need it.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSo if you’ve been really, really putting off your taxes, rest assured Block has some really, really good resources for you.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://ad.doubleclick.net/ddm/clk/484440674;291136607;l\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eLearn how Block has your back this tax season\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c/th\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso]\u003e\u003c! Elizabeth Warren (D-MA) speaks during a news conference concerning the extension of eviction protections in the next coronavirus bill, at the U.S. Capitol on July 22, 2020 in Washington, DC. \" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80MjIxL2VsaXphYmV0aF93YXJyZW4uanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=\"\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eDrew Angerer/Getty Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOne penny more and you would be facing an extra 2% tax under a \u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/warren-tax-bill-wealth-finance-millionaires-d966c220-31ff-4980-bc45-8e4531771ad8.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003enew proposal\u003c/a\u003e from Dems including Sen. Elizabeth Warren. Billionaires would be hit with 3%.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWarren's wealth tax proposal, a carryover from her run for president, would affect ~100,000 households and raise an estimated $2.8 trillion over 10 years, money its sponsors say \u003ca href=\"https://thehill.com/policy/finance/540968-warren-offers-bill-to-create-wealth-tax-on-net-worth-above-50-million?rl=1\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecould support\u003c/a\u003e child care, early education, and infrastructure. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWealth taxes are distinct from the income taxes you're probably filing right now. They apply to net worth, i.e., your \u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003ephysical assets\u003c/strong\u003e (houses, cars, grandma's sapphire collection) plus \u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eintangible assets\u003c/strong\u003e (stocks, grandma's new SPAC collection) minus\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e debts\u003c/strong\u003e (loans, mortgages, etc.). \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhile many politicians agree the ultra-wealthy should pay more, some disagree about whether wealth taxes are the way to go. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eLast week, Treasury Sec. Janet Yellen \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/janet-yellen-taxes-treasury-secretary-wealth-tax-implementation-capital-gains-2021-2?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esaid\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e a wealth tax has been discussed, but given \"very difficult implementation problems,\" the Biden administration would rather look into increased corporate or capital gains taxes. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eThe bill isn't expected to pass, even with Democratic control of Congress and the White House.
